subject: History
title: Greek Independence
description: A short lesson to help you apply Greek Independence.

hook.text: In 1821, Greece rose against the Ottoman Empire. European romantics joined the fightâ€”including Lord Byron.

buildup.text: After 400 years of Ottoman rule, Greek nationalists launched a war of independence in the Peloponnese.

discovery.text: The struggle inspired 'philhellenes' across Europeâ€”artists, soldiers, and intellectuals who volunteered to fight.

twist.text: Byron died of fever in Greece before seeing a battle. His death generated more sympathy than his poetry.

climax.text: Britain, France, and Russia intervened, destroying the Ottoman fleet at Navarino. Greece won with foreign help.

punchline.text: A poet's death moved empires to act.

quiz.question: What role did Lord Byron play in the Greek War of Independence?
options: He commanded Greek forces in a key battle
He died of fever in Greece, generating European sympathy for the cause
He negotiated the peace treaty with the Ottomans
